questions.question: What is the main challenge in duplicating the reactivity of enzymatic iron-oxo species in a synthetic system?
questions.answer: The main challenge is the instability of the terminal iron-oxo moiety, along with steric and electronic factors.

questions.question: What property of MOFs makes them appealing for supporting isolated terminal iron-oxo species?
questions.answer: The high surface area, permanent porosity, chemical and thermal stability, and synthetic tunability of MOFs make them appealing.

questions.question: What is the proposed active oxidant in the oxidation of ethane to ethanol using N2O in Fe2(dobdc)?
questions.answer: The proposed active oxidant is likely to be a high-spin S = 2 iron(IV)-oxo species.

questions.question: What are the challenges associated with heterogenizing molecular iron species on solid supports?
questions.answer: The challenges include difficulty in characterization, steric crowding, site inaccessibility, and metal leaching.

questions.question: What experimental techniques were used to investigate the binding of nitrous oxide to Fe2(dobdc)?
questions.answer: Powder neutron-diffraction data and in situ transmission-mode infrared spectroscopy were used.

questions.question: What was the outcome of flowing an N2O:ethane:Ar mixture over Fe2(dobdc) at 75°C?
questions.answer: The outcome was the formation of various ethane-derived oxygenates, including ethanol, acetaldehyde, diethyl ether, and other ether oligomers.

questions.question: What computational methods were used to study the electronic structure of Fe2(O)2(dobdc)?
questions.answer: Periodic PBE + U geometry optimizations, cluster DFT calculations, and single-point multiconfigurational complete active space (CASSCF) calculations followed by second-order perturbation theory (CASPT2) were used.

questions.question: True or False: The iron(III)-hydroxide species in Fe2(dobdc) is capable of activating weak C-H bonds.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the predicted ground state spin configuration for the iron(IV)-oxo species in Fe2(dobdc)?
questions.answer: The predicted ground state spin configuration was a quintet (S = 2).

questions.question: True or False: The Mo¨ssbauer spectrum of Fe0.1Mg1.9(dobdc) after N2O/ethane treatment showed that roughly 90% of the iron centres decayed into a species with similar spectral parameters as those of Fe2(OH)2(dobdc).
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the main finding from the reactivity studies of Fe2(dobdc) and Fe0.1Mg1.9(dobdc) with N2O and ethane?
questions.answer: The main finding was that these MOFs are likely capable of supporting fleeting iron(IV)-oxo species that possess an unusual S = 2 spin state, which can activate one of the strongest C-H bonds known.

questions.question: What was the effect of magnesium dilution in Fe2(dobdc) on the product selectivity in the oxidation of ethane?
questions.answer: Magnesium dilution in Fe2(dobdc) led to the exclusive formation of ethanol and acetaldehyde in a 10:1 ratio, albeit in low yield.

questions.question: True or False: The iron(IV)-oxo species in Fe2(dobdc) is stable and can be easily isolated.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the role of nitrous oxide in the oxidation of ethane to ethanol in Fe2(dobdc)?
questions.answer: Nitrous oxide acted as the terminal oxidant, likely forming a transient, high-spin iron(IV)-oxo intermediate that reacted to oxidize ethane.

questions.question: What challenges are associated with the characterization of iron cations incorporated into zeolites?
questions.answer: Characterization is nontrivial because of the presence of multiple iron species, making the nature of the active sites largely speculative.

questions.question: True or False: The iron(III)-hydroxide species in Fe2(dobdc) is incapable of activating strong C-H bonds.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the observed effect of heating N2O-dosed Fe2(dobdc) to 60°C?
questions.answer: Heating N2O-dosed Fe2(dobdc) to 60°C resulted in the formation of an Fe(III)-hydroxide species, suggesting the intermediacy of an iron(IV)-oxo species.

questions.question: True or False: The Mo¨ssbauer spectrum of Fe2(OH)2(dobdc) is consistent with high-spin Fe(III) species.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the outcome of the batch experiment using a Teﬂon-lined stainless-steel bomb for the oxidation of ethane in Fe0.1Mg1.9(dobdc)?
questions.answer: The batch experiment produced higher yields with respect to iron and selectivities for ethanol over acetaldehyde.

questions.question: True or False: The iron(IV)-oxo species in Fe2(dobdc) exhibits a trigonal bipyramidal coordination geometry.
questions.answer: False
